page.title: 02Historic Fairfield,Buxton.
page.content:
{St. Peter's Church.} There has been a church on the site for over seven hundred years, but the building we see today mainly dates from 1839, when the nave and the tower were built. In 1897 a porch was built onto the southern entrance. In 1902 the transepts, chancel and vestry were added. Until February 1951 the church was lit by gas. There are six stained glass windows in the church - one of them features a biplane. {Fairfield Low,}at 367 metres the highest point in Fairfield,is an ancient burial mound. Today it is marked by a clump of trees.
{Other Listed Buildings}in Fairfield include the Vicarage, Hawthorn Farm, Old Hall Cottages, and Cherry Tree Farmhouse.
